alert.note: Alert for Monterey (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 11 at 3:07AM PST until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in California... Salinas River near Bradley affecting Monterey County. For the Salinas River...including Bradley...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and continued minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salinas River near Bradley. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM PST Saturday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 AM PST Saturday was 19.6 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and will now fall slowly for the next few hours. The river is forecast to fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 18.7 feet on 02/10/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 300 PM PST.
